entry.title: Karabakh set to choose new president

media:group.media:title: Karabakh set to choose new president
media:group.media:description:
๐Azerbaijan continues to move troops toward Karabakh and Armenia, Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan warned. ๐U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken phoned Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev last week to discuss the situation in Karabakh. ๐Karabakhโs parliament indicated it will select State Minister Samvel Shahramanyan to serve as the regionโs next president. ๐The International Committee of the Red Cross evacuated 10 people in need of medical care from Karabakh to Armenia, according to Karabakhโs Health Ministry. ๐Alen Simonyan, the speaker of Armeniaโs parliament, said the country will โmost likelyโ become a member of the International Criminal Court.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Inside the risk of escalation as Azerbaijan ramps up threats against Armenia

media:group.media:title: Inside the risk of escalation as Azerbaijan ramps up threats against Armenia
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian assesses the fragile situation unfolding along Armenia's border with Azerbaijan.
He discusses the latest updates on the negotiations regarding the Karabakh blockade, the implications for Armenia if it signs the Rome Statute, and the growing concerns about Azerbaijan's military mobilization in border regions.
Hacopian breaks down the potential motives behind Azerbaijan's provocative rhetoric and military posturing and whether this could escalate into renewed aggression against Armenia.

entry.title: Azerbaijan moves troops, escalating fear of new war in region

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan moves troops, escalating fear of new war in region
media:group.media:description:
๐Karabakhโs Defense Ministry released a video appearing to show Azerbaijan moving troops and military equipment around the region, as tensions continue to escalate. ๐Armenian President Vahagn Khachaturyan recalled the countryโs representative to the CSTO, a Russian-led military alliance. ๐Armeniaโs Defense Ministry announced it would host joint military exercises with the United States later this month. ๐Anna Hakobyan, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyanโs wife, spoke at a summit in Kyiv, marking the first visit by a senior Armenian figure to Ukraine since Russiaโs invasion. ๐Local election monitoring group, Akanates, accused Armeniaโs ruling Civil Contract party of paying young women to take part in campaign events ahead of key city council elections in Yerevan.

entry.title: The IMF in Armenia: Relief, Reforms and Russia Sanctions

media:group.media:title: The IMF in Armenia: Relief, Reforms and Russia Sanctions
media:group.media:description:
Jihad Azour, director of the Middle East and Central Asia department at the International Monetary Fund, sits down with CivilNetโs Mark Dovich to talk about the IMFโs work in Armenia, including a new stand-by arrangement, which is a short-term financial assistance instrument. They also discuss what the Armenian currencyโs continued strength means for the country and the key issue of compliance with U.S. and European sanctions on Russia.
